page.title: 12HENKNOWLE PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: {The school} was built in {1972,}in very nice surroundings, for the Henknowle Estate. It looks modern, with a flat roof (renewed in 1983!), large windows and part pebble-dash, part tiled walls. It has three open-plan{classrooms} in the infant part and 4 in the juniors. In each classroom is a reading part with benches and a carpet. The hall in between is used for games, assembly and dining. There is a television and library room, a kitchen and offices. We have a{playground}and a{playing {field}with trees round the edge. When the by-pass is finished the field will be extended and we will hve a footbridge across the road. There are 97{children}aged 4-11, 4 teachers and a headmaster. A playgroup for younger children meets in one of the infant rooms each morning.
